Message.Title: Buybacks
Message.Msg: With 13 billion from Alibaba and 7 Billion from Yahoo Japan. If YHOO did not grow core and just used its proceeds to buyback stock, they could easily earn over 2 bucks a share. Today, the largest buyback program is HD. Check out that stock. Company has a buyback of around 17%. At present, the 20 in cash out of 26 market cap would be the largest buyback program (~77%). The shares outstanding could go from over a billion to HALF that. This would double EPS at present. Again, thats taking into account ZERO growth. If they can grow 10%, EPS is going to really run...This has potential to be the stock of 2013 and 2014. Good Luck.

Message.Title: What is Yahoo worth today?
Message.Msg: What is Yahoo worth today? - Alibaba is going to be worth about $80 billion when it IPOs this year based on what it will do next year (go look at Oppenheimer’s last report or read some of my earlier posts explaining why). Yahoo still owns 24% of it. After paying tax on that stake, it’s worth $13 billion (which is conservative as Yahoo will probably retain 10% of Alibaba post-IPO and let it increase in value). - Yahoo’s 35% stake in Yahoo Japan is worth $10 billion at current prices. After taxes, that’s $6.85 billion. If you think Yahoo core is worth at least as much (although I’d say it deserves a premium to AOL), then Yahoo core is worth 6x its trailing year’s EBITDA (because that’s what the market says AOL is worth). This means Yahoo core is worth $9 billion. - Combined, we have a sum-of-the-parts story that says Yahoo’s worth $29 billion. Currently, it’s trading at $27 billion. There’s probably going to be about 1 billion shares left after they say how many they bought back in Q1. So, the “fair value” for this stock right now is $29… not $24. Add Yahoo's cash to the above and Yahoo's value is well north of $30/share today.

Topic.Title: Apple and Yahoo In Talks Over Deeper iPhone Partnership

Message.Msg: A couple of months ago Marissa said that Yahoo was in a place to be friends to everyone. I think this is what she meant. This is classic triangulation, using yahoo's independence to her benefit, playing Google and Apple against each other while she improves and updates yahoo's products. She also said it is all about mobile and her acqui-hires have all been right down that line. The latest, Summly could be really critical because abbreviating top stories for mobile-scrollable sounds really addictive to me. This is a really interesting business story. Nobody walks on water but Marissa appears to be two steps ahead of all the pundits and prognosticators. I think she has a definite strategy but she isn't going to tell Kara Swisher about it. When you have a winning hand, that's the time to lay low.

Topic.Title: Apple and Yahoo In Talks Over Deeper iPhone Partnership

Message.Title: Temper your trades: A tightening of the model.
Message.Msg: Temper your trades 4)April 1st, 2nd more ytd(& alltime) high(s) 14684.49 thus far, widening ytd range to 1580.19 raising ytd (& alltime) E[X] to 13894.39(& 7356.48) resp. Closing the week 14565.25 By April 11th more ytd(& alltime) high(s) 14887.51 thus far, widening ytd range to 1783.21, raising ytd (& alltime) E[X] to 13995.9(& 7457.995) resp. Closing the week 14865.06(& exceeding 2012 range! already) A tightening of the model. Average ytd-range from 1989 to(incld) this yr 2013 is, (current) 1,935.12 points for $DJI. Ranges for 11' & 12' were 2,471.71 & 1626.71 points. Using current ytd low & high, one then add(to ytd low) & subtract(from ytd high) the average range. This gives us the fol(current) 2013 proj for $DJI is the upside(downside)-risk of 15039.42(12952.39). In 1992 the ytd range for $DJI was a mere 272 POINTS!(imagine that) In 1994 a range of 433.78 is realised. By 1995 we see a jump to the 1000 point range for $DJI, we note the honourable Pres Clinton's Aid to Mexico Jan 1995. By 1999 a 2000 point range realised on $DJI. 2001 heralds a 3000 point range for $DJI By 2008 a 5830.16 point range prints, we note a skip of the 4000 point range. One may ask, where will we land on a next skip, would you expect or better yet could you survive a 10000 ytd range print? Temper your positions.

Message.Title: Yahoo! Partnership Is Apple’s Best Option to Attack Google’s Android
Message.Msg: Yahoo! is said to be talking with Apple about a partnership, according to a report from Bloomberg. Given the mobile-focused strategy that Yahoo!’s CEO, Marissa Mayer, has laid out, the report should not be a surprise. But while closer integration would obviously benefit Yahoo!, Apple would be just as well served. In particular, working closely with Yahoo! would help Apple stymie Google’s Android. But in the end, the biggest winner in any deal would be Yahoo!. Many years ago, Yahoo! competed directly with Google; yet, at some point, the company was passed by. Mayer seems to be poised to bring Yahoo! back to Google’s level, and a deal with Apple would dramatically accelerate that process. For its part, Apple would do well to go along for the time being. Helping Yahoo! compete with Google once more could help slow the growth of Android and keep consumers flocking to Apple’s iDevices.

Message.Title: YHOO Buybacks estimated at 250,000/day @ $21.45 average price
Message.Msg: Anyone studied YHOO tape recently? Past few weeks, a few seconds before 4:00 PM Eastern, a large block (typically 250,000 shares) crosses at the ask price. I'm estimating Yahoo is buying back about $5 million shares a day. My estimate for Q1 share buybacks is $500 million.
